title: Risk Business Analyst at Open Systems Technologies (New York City, NY)
text: Source: BullhornReach.com The role offers the opportunity to work with risk management teams in capturing requirements to support activities such as Basel reporting, CCAR (Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review), Loss Mitigation, Collections and Consumer Modeling. The candidate acts as a senior business process and data analyst, specification writer, implementation support resource and subject matter advisor, engaging a diverse set of business and technology groups. This person must provide business analysis expertise to deliver critical requirements artifacts, work closely with the technology team, and provide subject matter expertise in support of all other teams in the effort. The role requires in-depth and sophisticated analysis with interpretive thinking, problem definition, and development of innovative solutions. Key Responsibilities • Elicit, analyze and validate requirements through various techniques (data analysis, process analysis, prototyping, use cases, business rules definition, etc) • Document requirements according to standards, achieve consensus and obtain sign-off from key stakeholders • Define the data input, processing/enrichment and output requirements associated with system and data interfaces needed to satisfy the business requirements. Analyze the actual data, identify/communicate data quality issues and work with other teams as needed to resolve them. • Follow SDLC process and documentation standards and best practices to produce deliverables • Assist the development, testing and production support efforts as needed, providing requirements knowledge and subject matter expertise to the teams performing these functions • Manage requirement changes via a change control process • Identify, communicate and resolve issues and risks as they arise anywhere in the end to end process • Continuously improve subject matter expertise in the business areas being supported, sufficient to become a trusted advisor to the business stakeholders Qualifications - Knowledge/Experience • Must be a business requirements analyst with a strong user experience background • 7+ years of financial industry experience is required • Direct experience (minimum 7 years) in business process, data analysis, requirements resolution, documentation, validation and change control processes is a must • Prior working experience with Retail banking or Credit Cards or Consumer Risk is a strong plus • Experience (minimum 3 years) working on global projects with stakeholders located around the globe is a must • Experience working on projects encompassing both IT systems and business process change a must • BS or equivalent degree Qualifications – Skills • Must have extremely strong listening, requirements elicitation, analysis and problem solving skills • Must have extremely strong interpersonal skills – collaboration across multiple business and technology functions, relationship building and consensus building are a must • Must have extremely strong documentation and oral communications skills • Must be a self starter and work productively with minimal direction • Must learn quickly and produce under pressure and tight deadlines • Must be able to demonstrate functional and business knowledge regarding prior projects • Must have strong SQL data querying and analysis skills • Must have strong Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, MS Word and MS Access knowledge • Blueprint tool experience is a strong plus • Agile project experience is a strong plus
